discussion.content: D. when you pivot to an Event Search from a detection's details in CrowdStrike, it provides a focused view of the event data surrounding the detection, D shows a 10-minute window of events before and after the detection, allowing us to quickly review relevant events and take appropriate actions.

Selected Answer: A
A

A. It takes you to the event data related to the detection and provides you with a number of Event Actions

Selected Answer: A
A is Correct

questions.question_text: When looking at a detection's details, you can pivot to an Event Search. What is the purpose of this Event Search?

choices.D: It takes you to the Event Search and shows a +/-10-minute window of events
choices.C: It allows the analyst to view the full detection details
choices.A: It takes you to the event data related to the detection and provides you with a number of Event Actions
choices.B: It provides chronological list of all the event data for the host

questions.question_text: What part of the Investigate module should you use when you want to write custom queries to analyze, explore, or hunt for suspicious or malicious activity in your environment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Event Search.

Only this answers is related or can use for write custom queries to search

questions.question_text: Which structured analytic technique contrasts different hypotheses to determine which is the best leading (prioritized) hypothesis?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Analysis of competing hypotheses
